definition: to show results/effective
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
effect/efficacy/to imitate
variant of 傚|效[xiao4]
variant of 效[xiao4]/to imitate
variant of 效[xiao4]

sentences.english: The Microsoft search deal was a non-event.
sentences.chinese: 与微软达成的搜索交易没有奏效。

sentences.english: And for this, hand-in-hand will work better than fist-to-fist.
sentences.chinese: 为此目的，手拉手比拳对拳要奏效。

sentences.english: Accepting that silo marketing is ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 接受筒仓营销并不奏效。

sentences.english: Factorization of this equation by trial and error is not possible.
sentences.chinese: 用试凑法对这个方程进行因式分解是不可能奏效的。

sentences.english: Of course all the familiar principles of fairness and equal opportunity still matter.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们熟悉的公平以及机会均等的法则依然奏效。

sentences.english: It has not worked several times, " Ricks reminded Greene.
For tuberculosis, control efforts are paying off.
sentences.chinese: 至于结核病，控制努力正在奏效。

sentences.english: But Project Euston will have to work first.
sentences.chinese: 但首先尤斯顿项目必须奏效。

sentences.english: Various academic studies have found that anti-takeover defences seem to pay.
sentences.chinese: 学术研究发现，反收购防御将会奏效。

sentences.english: "We believe that the industry is trying to force-fit the PC into the living room, and it won't work, " he says.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为业界正尝试将电脑强加给客厅，这不会奏效。

sentences.english: But these schemes never worked for long.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些计划都无法长期奏效。

sentences.english: In mercantile, or philanthropic endeavors, the same principle holds good.
sentences.chinese: 在商业或慈善事业中，同样的原则同样奏效。
尼克松的工资和价格监管方案未能奏效。

sentences.english: If it works, they hope to expand their methods nationally.
sentences.chinese: 如果该方法奏效，他们希望将它扩展到全国。

sentences.english: This doesn't work (last time I tried), with just the escape sequence in double quotes.
sentences.chinese: 上次我试验在双引号中加上新行的键值并不能奏效。

sentences.english: Smarmy might work better, though it is difficult to bring off.
sentences.chinese: 奉承也许会更有用，不过很难奏效。

definition: well-tried/time-tested
to yield results
lit. set up a pole and see the shadow (idiom); fig. instant effect/quick results
to have the desired effect
to no avail/achieving nothing/totally ineffective/to have no effect/to fall flat (esp. of joke or speech that is completely ignored)
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
won't work/will get (you) nowhere
to use/to exert
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to have an effect/to play a role/to be operative/to work/to function
to win by a surprise move
practicable/realizable/will work
to treat the symptoms but not the root cause
to brandish (a figurative weapon, i.e. some measure intended to deal with the situation)/to resort to (some tactic)
to take drastic measures to deal with a situation/to pull the carpet from under sb
